name: istio_high_request_latency
description: The Istio High Request Latency incident type refers to an issue where the average execution time for requests in Istio is longer than the expected threshold of 100ms. This may result in slow or unresponsive services, negatively impacting the user experience. It may require investigation and troubleshooting to identify the underlying cause and resolve the issue.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Istio High Request Latency
The Istio High Request Latency incident type refers to an issue where the average execution time for requests in Istio is longer than the expected threshold of 100ms. This may result in slow or unresponsive services, negatively impacting the user experience. It may require investigation and troubleshooting to identify the underlying cause and resolve the issue.

cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl get ns istio-system`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Resource constraints: The service may be under-resourced, leading to a slower response time for requests.

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | random=1 | limit=1 | invoke_check_pod_resources($POD_NAME)

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## If the issue is related to hardware resource constraints, consider increasing the resources allocated to the affected service or adding more nodes to the cluster.
